observations: Output grid dimensions are exactly 2 times the input dimensions.
The output consists of a 2x2 tiling of blocks matching the input size.
hypotheses: The output grid is generated by repeating the input grid 2x2 times.
The output grid is generated by reflecting the input grid along the horizontal and vertical axes.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: The output grid is generated by reflecting the input grid along the horizontal and vertical axes.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: This produces a different arrangement of the input grid cells than observed in training examples.

selected_rule: The output grid is generated by repeating the input grid 2x2 times.
step_plan: Multiply the number of rows in the input by 2 to get the number of rows in the output.
Multiply the number of columns in the input by 2 to get the number of columns in the output.
Create a new grid with the calculated output dimensions.
Repeat the input grid across the rows and columns of the output grid.
